extendedInfo.detail: For holiday meals or everyday dinners, enjoy Pepperidge Farm Stuffing - made from our premium bread to create a gratifyingly delicious side dish! Our delicious Stuffing is perfect for effortless entertaining with the option of adding a personal touch.
extendedInfo.ingredients: Made From: Enriched Wheat Flour (Flour, Niacin, Reduced Iron, Thiamine Mononitrate, Riboflavin, Folic Acid), Corn Meal, Sugar, Vegetable Oils (Canola And/Or Palm), Salt, Contains 2% Or Less Of: Yeast, Onion Powder, Calcium Propionate To Extend Freshness, Spices, Celery, Paprika, Malted Barley Flour, Rosemary Extract And Ascorbic Acid To Protect Flavor, Soy Lecithin.
extendedInfo.directions: Stuffing Preparation Guide: Servings: Pepperidge Farm Stuffing: 6 oz (half pack) 6; 12 oz (full pack) 13. Servings: Butter: (2 tbsp) 6; (4 tbsp) 13. Servings: Onion and Celery Diced; 1/2 cup each (6) ; 1 cup each (13) . Servings: Swanson Chicken Broth: 1 cup (6); 2 cups (13). Our favorite stuffing stir-ins: 4 oz Cooked chorizo sausage, diced; 1 Cup frozen whole kernel corn, thawed; 1/2 cup red and/or green peppers chopped; 1/2 cup Colby and monetary jack cheese blend. (1) Getting Started: Ingredients yields about 13 serving: 4tbsp Butter; 1 cup diced onion (about 1 large); 1 cup diced celery (about 2 stalks); 2 cups Swanson Chicken Broth; 1 pkg Pepperidge Farm (12oz.) Corn Bread Classic Stuffing. (2) Prepare Stuffing Mixture: Heat butter in 4-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and celery. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp. Add broth and heat to a boil. Remove saucepan from heat. Add stuffing and mix lightly. (3) In Casserole: Heat oven to 350 degree F. Spoon stuffing mixture into greased 2-quart casserole dish. Cover and bake 35 minutes or until hot. To make ahead: Cover unbaked stuffing mixture in casserole dish and refrigerate up to 1 day. Bake 40 minutes or until hot. For more crisp stuffing bake uncovered. (1) Getting Started: Ingredients yields about 13 serving: 4tbsp Butter; 1 cup diced onion (about 1 large); 1 cup diced celery (about 2 stalks); 2 cups Swanson Chicken Broth; 1 pkg Pepperidge Farm (12oz.) Corn Bread Classic Stuffing. (2) Prepare Stuffing Mixture: Heat butter in 4-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and celery. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp. Add broth and heat to a boil. Remove saucepan from heat. Add stuffing and mix lightly. (3) In Bird: Loosely spoon stuffing mixture into turkey cavity. Spoon any remaining stuffing mixture into greased casserole dish. Cover and bake with turkey during last 35 minutes of roasting time. Roast turkey according to package directions. Allow turkey to stand 20 minutes before removing stuffing and slicing. (1) Getting Started: Ingredients yields about 13 serving: 4tbsp Butter; 1 cup diced onion (about 1 large); 1 cup diced celery (about 2 stalks); 2 cups Swanson Chicken Broth; 1 pkg Pepperidge Farm (12oz.) Corn Bread Classic Stuffing. (2) Prepare Stuffing Mixture: Heat butter in 4-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and celery. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp. Add broth and heat to a boil. Remove saucepan from heat. Add stuffing and mix lightly. (3) On Top of Stove: Leave stuffing mixture in saucepan. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving.
extendedInfo.warnings: Contains: wheat, Soy.Do not purchase if bag is open or torn.
